mission: Land a $85k–$115k Leadership/Coordinator role by June 2026
pitch: I'm transitioning out of the classroom in June. I'm looking for a Leadership or Coordinator role in Educational Technology or Media Arts in the New Haven area. I want to use my background as a Film Professor and Product Designer to help an institution build out their AI, VR, or Digital Media programs. I'm looking for something in the $85k–$100k range where I can focus on high-level projects rather than day-to-day classroom management.

comfortMath.note: Hits 'Comfort' goal immediately. 9-to-5 with no grading = fresh brain at 5:01 PM for Ahoy and film.

targetRoles.title: Director of Instructional Technology (Private Schools)
targetRoles.description: Help other teachers use tech (AI, VR, etc.) and manage the school's MakerSpace.

targetRoles.title: Media Arts / Film Coordinator (Higher Ed or Prep)
targetRoles.description: Managing equipment, studios, and teaching high-level electives. No foundational behavior management.

targetRoles.title: Instructional Designer / Learning Architect
targetRoles.description: Building 'Learn-at-home' style sites for companies or universities. Build the course once, it lives forever.

targetRoles.title: Coordinator, AI Academy / STEM Outreach
targetRoles.description: Specialized roles focusing on specific tech initiatives (like Charter Oak State College).

roadmap.goal: Update LinkedIn & Portfolio. Shift from 'STEM Teacher' to 'Educational Technology Leader.' Reach out to 3 friend networks (Apeworx, Choate, New Haven Arts).
Active Applications. Focus on 5–10 high-quality 'Director' or 'Coordinator' roles. Don't spray and pray — use portfolio to send direct, tailored messages to hiring managers.
The Interview Phase. Most education-sector offers finalized here. Know your future by early May.
Wrap up Bridgeport. Focus on filmmaking/Ahoy projects as you transition out of STEM role.

hiringCycles.privateSchools: Late Feb – April for late-August start. Looking for Directors of Technology and Media Arts staff RIGHT NOW.
hiringCycles.higherEd: Notoriously slow (3–5 months). Starting in Feb gives lead time to survive HR bureaucracy for July/Aug start.
hiringCycles.edtechStartups: 2–3 months from first application to first paycheck. Applying March/April lines up June/July start.

Update job tracker (add new leads, update statuses)

Review tomorrow's targets and prep any cover letter drafts

Follow up on all pending applications (check status, send nudges)
Reach out to 2 people in your network with the 'Pitch'
Review and refine resume/portfolio based on what's working
Weekly reflection: What worked? What to change? Update roadmap.
